place_of_publication.publication_title: J. Proc. Linn. Soc., Bot., suppl.

treatment.description: Plants 0.5–3 cm. Leaves lingulate, crisped when dry, 2–4 mm, broadly acute to obtuse, margins irregularly dentate distally, distal cells 14–20 µm wide, irregularly hexagonal, rather thin-walled. Seta 3–4 mm. Capsule 0.6–1 mm; peristome teeth narrowly lanceolate to subulate, smooth to faintly striolate, to 500 µm. Spores 18–20 µm.
treatment.discussion: On the North American continent, this species is known from a single locality in the Appalachian Mountains (R. H. Zander 1966).
